cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (forecast to become hurricane by Tue night)
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles south of Cozumel, Mexico

motion.direction: North (expected to resume slow northward motion)
motion.speed: Stationary now, forecast to accelerate to ~7–10 mph

cyclone.trajectory: Turning north-north-east across the eastern Gulf toward the Florida Panhandle then inland across Georgia and the Carolinas

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for the U.S. coastline yet (warnings confined to western Cuba and Yucatan)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for the U.S. coastline yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northeast and north-central U.S. Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the Florida Big Bend, with effects extending onto the west-central Florida peninsula
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (moist south-easterly bands could bring 3-5 inches locally)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (present guidance keeps main surge north of Tampa Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible late Tue night through Wed night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft in Tampa Bay possible if onshore flow develops; values >3 ft not currently indicated
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands beginning late Monday; widespread 2–4 in with isolated 4–6 in by Wednesday–Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands and temporary navigation restrictions due to rough seas in Tampa Bay
